com.ikalagaming.core

Class SystemProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.core.SystemProperties

  • public class SystemProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for fetching various system information such as the Java version or the directory in which applications store data.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Method Detail

      • getHomeDir

        public static java.lang.String getHomeDir()
        Returns the home directory for the program. This is the application data folder and NOT the games root folder. The games folder is contained in this directory. For example, the game 'TextGame's folder would look like getHomeDir() + "/TextGame/" on a Windows computer.
        Operating System Directory
        WINDOWS System.getenv("APPDATA")
        MAC Users home directory + "/Library/Application Support"
        LINUX Users home directory
        UNKNOWN(anything else) The user's current working directory

        The users home directory is defined as System.getProperty("user.home")

        Returns:
        the programs home directory

      • getOS

        public static java.lang.String getOS()
        Returns the OS name. Note that this is not equivalent to System.getProperty("os.name") Possible OS names are:
        • WINDOWS
        • MAC
        • LINUX
        • UNKNOWN
        Returns:
        the name of the OS
        See Also:
        getOSActualName()

      • getOSActualName

        public static java.lang.String getOSActualName()
        Returns the OS name returned by System.getProperty("os.name"). Please note that this is not the same thing as getOS().
        Returns:
        operating system name
        See Also:
        getOS()

      • getOSArch

        public static java.lang.String getOSArch()
        Returns the current Operating system architecture. This is the same thing as calling System.getProperty("os.arch")
        Returns:
        operating system architecture

      • getOSVersion

        public static java.lang.String getOSVersion()
        Returns the current Operating system version. This is the same thing as calling System.getProperty("os.version")
        Returns:
        operating system version

      • getTmpDir

        public static java.lang.String getTmpDir()
        Returns the Default temp file path. This is the same thing as calling System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")
        Returns:
        default temp file path
